data.title: Pilgrims Progress by Bunyan, First Edition
data.meta_description: The Pilgrims Progress by John Bunyan and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Paperback. Condition: New. 400pp. [20.25 cm]. Illustrated wraps. Now available together in a single volume, these two classics were written by seventeenth-century England's most famous prisoner of conscience, Baptist John Bunyan (1628-1688). Imprisoned for twelve years for his preaching, he wrote first a dramatic allegory of Christian life and followed it with the compelling story of his own conversion. Both have been beloved by generations of spiritual seekers and still speak powerfully to modern readers. Pilgrim's Progress recounts the perilous journey of Christian from the City of Destruction to the Celestial City, and in its second part, follows the journey of his wife, Christiana. Grace Abounding to the Chief of Sinners is Bunyan's fervent memoir of his own spiritual regeneration. Both works are enduring masterpieces of English prose, uniting the simple power of Biblical language with the vivid bluntness of untutored speech. A Vintage Spiritual Classics Original; First Edition.

Paperback. Condition: new. Paperback. 'This fire is the work of grace that is wrought in the heart' In John Bunyan's classic allegory, Christian abandons his family and the City of Destruction and sets off for salvation. His path is straight but not easy, and he is beset by trials, including the terrible violence of the destructive Apollyon and the Giant Despair, as he pursues his pilgrimage through the Slough of Despond, the Delectable Mountains and Vanity-Fair towards the Celestial City. In the second part of the narrative his wife, Christiana, is escorted by Great-heart through the same difficult terrain. Written with the urgency of persecuted faith and a fiery imagination, The Pilgrim's Progress is a spiritual as well as a literary classic. In his introduction, Roger Pooley discusses Bunyan's life and theology, as well as the text's biblical and historial backdrop, its success and critial history. This edition also includes accompanying seventeenth-century illustrations, a chronology, suggested further reading, notes and an index. John Bunyan began this book while he was in prison for conducting unauthorised Baptist religious services outside of the Church of England. His path is straight but not easy, and he is beset by trials, including the terrible violence of the destructive Apollyon and the Giant Despair, as he pursues his pilgrimage through the Slough of Despond. Shipping may be from multiple locations in the US or from the UK, depending on stock availability.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good+. Dust Jacket Condition: No Dust Jacket. First Edition Thus. An undated likely First Everyman's Library edition, 1907. The famous Christian allegorical work in a compact Everyman's Library reprint edition. First published in two parts in 1678 and 1685; this single volume contains both, each preceded by the author's apology in verse. With an introduction by Rev. H. Elvet Lewis, which includes a few illustrations. Number 204 in Everyman's Library catalog in their Romance series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In "flatback" binding style 1, full blue cloth-covered boards with Reginald Knowles-designed spine titling & decorations in gilt, blindstamped J. M. Dent vignette to front cover, brown topstain and fancy Knowles woodcut art at title page & frontis. Lacks the dust jacket. --- With mild dulling to part of the spine decorations, some light chafing to cloth and prior owner's penciled name to front free endpaper, otherwise a tightly-bound, unmarked, sound copy.; 16mo (6 to 7 in. tall); xx, 383 pages.

Hardcover. Very Good in Very Good DJ: Both book and DJ show indications of moderate use. The Book shows moderate shelving wear along the bottom edge of the boards and light wear to the up extremities; mild rubbing; the hinges are starting but the binding remains square and somewhat precariously secure; the pages have tanned rather heavily; the text is clean. The DJ shows mild rubbing; faint soiling to the white background field of the rear panel; the backstrip is very lightly sunned; light wear to extremities, with scant loss due to rubbing at the head and heel of the backstrip and at the upper corner tips; unclipped. Shows a little wear and the hinges are a worry, but remains a clean, sturdy copy, with the seldom seen DJ in attractive condition. NOT a Remainder, Book-Club, or Ex-Library. 8vo. 309pp. First Edition Thus [1945], Third Printing [1949]. Hardback with DJ. First Edition Thus [1945], Third Printing [1949].
